Huffman or his research group and identified as JWH-007; JWH-015; JWH-018; JWH-019; JWH-030; JWH-047; JWH-048; JWH-051; JWH-057; JWH-073; JWH-081; JWH-098; JWH-116; JWH-120; JWH-122; JWH-133; JWH-139; JWH-147; JWH-148; JWH-149; JWH-161; JWH-164; JWH-166; JWH-167; JWH-171; JWH-175; JWH-176; JWH-181; JWH-182; JWH-184; JWH-185; JWH-192; JWH-193; JWH-194; JWH-195; JWH-196; JWH-197; JWH-198; JWH-199; JWH-200; JWH-203; JWH-205; JWH-210; JWH-213; JWH-229; JWH-234; JWH-249; JWH 250; JWH-251; JWH-253; JWH-258; JWH-300; JWH-302; JWH-307; JWH-336; JWH-350; JWH-359; JWH-387; JWH-398; JWH-424; and other substances with a structure and effect that is substantially similar to those listed. The term shall not include synthetic cannabinoids that require a prescription, are approved by the United States Food and Drug Administration and are dispensed in accordance with state and federal law. 
(Ord. No. 2012-01, § 1, 6-12-2012) 
Article III. - Possession of Marijuana 

9.32.050 - Possession of marijuana. 
A.  Except as authorized by state law, it shall be unlawful for any person to use or possess marijuana. 
B.  When a person who has not been previously convicted of an offense under Section 9.32.050 or any law of the United States or any other state, or any ordinance relating to controlled substances, pleads guilty to use or possession of marijuana, the court, without entering a judgment of guilt with the consent of the accused, may defer further proceedings and place the individual on probation upon terms and conditions that shall include, but are not limited to, payment of a probation supervision program, community service, fines and costs and all other conditions determined by the court. Upon violation of a term or condition, the court may enter an adjudication of guilt and proceed as otherwise provided. Upon fulfillment of the terms and conditions, the court shall discharge the person and dismiss the proceedings. Discharge and dismissal under this section shall be without an adjudication of guilt and except as provided in Subsection (C)2 is not a conviction for purposes of this section. A person is not eligible for adjudication under this section if the person has previously received a dismissal under this section, MCL 333.7411, or any other statute or ordinance for a controlled substance offense. 
C.  The Records and Identifications Division of the Department of State Police shall retain a nonpublic record of an arrest and discharge of dismissal under this section. This record shall be published to any or all of the following: 
1.  To a court, police agency, or prosecuting attorney upon request for the purpose of showing that a defendant in a criminal action involving possession or use of a controlled substance has already utilized this section for a dismissal of a controlled substance offense. 
2.  To a court, police agency, or prosecuting attorney upon request for the purpose of determining whether the defendant in a subsequent criminal action is eligible for discharge of dismissal of proceedings. 
(Ord. No. 2012-02, § 1, 6-12-2012)

Chapter 9.40 - FIREARMS[9] 
Sections: 

Footnotes: 
--- (9) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 2011-09, § 1, adopted March 8, 2011, repealed former Ch. 9.40, §§ 9.40.010-9.40.100, in its entirety and enacted new provisions a herein set out. Former Ch. 9.40 derived from Ord. No. 58,, §§ 2-5, 1965; Ord. No. 88, §§ 31-34, 91; 1972; Ord. No. 58A-2, § 3, 1984. 

9.40.010 - Prohibition of discharge. 
    Unless otherwise permitted by law or stated herein, there shall be no discharge of any rim-fire hand-gun, rifle, or other weapon, or center-fire rifle or hand-gun allowed within the City's limits. Nothing in this section shall be construed to limit the activities of organizations operating in accordance with Public Act 269 of the Public Acts of Michigan of 1989, as amended. 
(Ord. No. 2011-09, § 1, 3-8-2011) 
9.40.020 - Careless, reckless or negligent use of firearms. 
    Any person who, because of carelessness, recklessness or negligence, but not wilfully or wantonly, shall cause or allow any firearm under his control to be discharged so as to destroy or injure the property of another, real or personal, shall be guilty of a misdemeanor, punishable by imprisonment for not more than ninety days or by a fine of not more than one hundred dollars. 
(Ord. No. 2011-09, § 1, 3-8-2011) 
9.40.030 - Reckless, wanton use or negligent discharge of firearm. 
    Any person who shall recklessly or heedlessly or wilfully or wantonly use, carry, handle or discharge any firearm without due caution and circumspection for the rights, safety or property of others shall be guilty of a misdemeanor. 
(Ord. No. 2011-09, § 1, 3-8-2011) 
9.40.040 - Pointing or aiming firearm at another person. 
A.  A person who intentionally but without malice points or aims a firearm at or toward another person is guilty of a misdemeanor punishable by imprisonment for not more than ninety-three days or a fine of not more than five hundred dollars, or both. 
B.  This section does not apply to a peace officer of this state or another state, or of a local unit of government of this state or another state, or of the United States, performing his or her duties as a peace officer. 
(Ord. No. 2011-09, § 1, 3-8-2011) 
9.40.050 - Brandishing firearm in public. 
A.  Except as provided in subsection (B), a person who knowingly brandishes a firearm in public, shall be guilty of a misdemeanor punishable by imprisonment for not more than 90 days, or a fine of not more than $100.00, or both. 
B.  Subsection (A) does not apply to any of the following: 
i.  A peace officer lawfully performing his or her duties as a peace officer. 
ii.  A person lawfully engaged in hunting. 
iii.  A person lawfully engaged in target practice. 
iv.  A person lawfully engaged in the sale, purchase, repair, or transfer of that firearm. 
(Ord. No. 2011-09, § 1, 3-8-2011) 
9.40.060 - Hunting and trapping. 
A.  Shotguns may be discharged for the purpose of hunting, and bow-hunting is permitted on land parcels of fifteen (15) acres or more. 
B.  Trapping is permitted on parcels of ten (10) acres or more. 
C.  Persons hunting or trapping must have written permission of the property owner on her/his person while hunting or trapping unless he/she is the property owner. Evidence of written property owner permission must be signed and dated by the property owner of record and have a date within three months of when a person is hunting or trapping. 
D.  No hunting, trapping or discharge of a shotgun or bow for any reason shall occur within four hundred fifty feet of any building or adjoining land without the written permission of the owner and occupant of this safety zone. 
(Ord. No. 2011-09, § 1, 3-8-2011) 
9.40.070 - Transporting or possessing firearms. 
A.  Except as otherwise permitted by law, a person who transports or possesses in or upon a sailboat or a motor vehicle, aircraft, motorboat, or any other vehicle propelled by mechanical means, a firearm, other than a hand-gun, which is loaded, shall be guilty of a misdemeanor. 
B.  Except as otherwise permitted by law, a person who transports or possess in or upon a motor vehicle or any self-propelled vehicle designed for land travel a firearm, other than a hand-gun, is guilty of a misdemeanor, unless the firearm is unloaded and is 1 or more of the following: 
i.  Taken down. 
ii.  Enclosed in a case. 
iii.  Carried in the trunk of the vehicle. 
iv.  Inaccessible from the interior of the vehicle. 
C.  This section does not apply to any of the following: 
i.  A peace officer of an authorized police agency of the United States, of this state, or of a political subdivision of this state, who is regularly employed and paid by the United States, this state, or a political subdivision of this state. 
ii.  A person who is regularly employed by the state department of corrections and who is authorized in writing by the director of the department of corrections to carry a concealed weapon while in the official performance of his or her duties or while going to or returning from those duties. 
iii.  A person employed by a private vendor that operates a youth correctional facility authorized under section 20g of 1953 PA 232, MCL 791.220g, who meets the same criteria established by the director of the state department of corrections for departmental employees described in subdivision (b) and who is authorized in writing by the director of the department of corrections to carry a concealed weapon while in the official performance of his or her duties or while going to or returning from those duties. 
iv.  A member of the United States Army, Air Force, Navy, or Marine Corps or the United States Coast Guard while carrying weapons in the line of or incidental to duty. 
v.  An organization authorized by law to purchase or receive weapons from the United States or from this state. 
vi.  A member of the national guard, armed forces reserve, the United States coast guard reserve, or any other authorized military organization while on duty or drill, or in going to or returning from a place of assembly or practice, while carrying weapons used for a purpose of the national guard, armed forces reserve, United States coast guard reserve, or other duly authorized military organization. 
vii.  A security employee employed by the state and granted limited arrest powers under section 6c of 1935 PA 59, MCL 28.6c. 
viii.  A motor carrier officer appointed under section 6d of 1935 PA 59, MCL 28.6d. 
(Ord. No. 2011-09, § 1, 3-8-2011) 
9.40.080 - Selling firearms and ammunition. 
A.  A person who knowingly sells a hand-gun without complying with section 2 of Act No. 372 of the Public Acts of 1927, as amended, being section 28.422 of the Michigan Compiled Laws, is guilty of a misdemeanor, punishable by imprisonment for not more than ninetydays, or a fine of not more than one hundred dollars, or both. 
B.  A person who knowingly sells a firearm more than thirty inches in length to a person under eighteen years of age is guilty of a misdemeanor, punishable by imprisonment for not more than ninety days, or a fine of not more than five hundred dollars, or both. 
(Ord. No. 2011-09, § 1, 3-8-2011) 
9.40.090 - Use by police. 
    Nothing contained in this chapter shall prevent regular policemen, special policemen and auxiliary policemen from using an open-air range in the city or elsewhere for the purpose of target practice. Such activity shall be subject to the control and discretion of the chief of police as to scheduling the time and determining the location for such target practice and in all other respects 
(Ord. No. 2011-09, § 1, 3-8-2011)

Chapter 10.16 - SNOWMOBILES[4] 
Sections: 

Footnotes: 
--- (4) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 2011-14, § 1, adopted March 8, 2011, repealed former Ch. 10.16, §§ 10.16.010-10.16.120, in its entirety and enacted new provisions as herein set out. Former Ch. 10.16 pertained to similar subject matter and derived from Ord. No. 86, §§ 2-8, 10, 1972. 

10.16.010 - Purpose. 
    The purpose of this chapter is to regulate and control the operation and use of snowmobiles within the City of Wixom for the protection of the health, safety and general welfare of the residents, property owners, visitors and others within the city, and is adopted under the authority of Part 821 of Public Act 451 of 1994, the Natural Resources and Environmental Protection Act, as amended to the date of the adoption of the within ordinance. 
(Ord. No. 2011-14, § 1, 3-8-11) 
10.16.020 - Definitions. 
    The following terms, when used in the within ordinance, shall have the following meanings: 
A.  "Operator" means any person who operates or is in actual physical control of a snowmobile. 
B.  "Owner" means any of the following: 
1.  A person who holds the legal title of a snowmobile. 
2.  A vendee or lessee of the snowmobile which is the subject of an agreement for the conditional sale or lease thereof with the right of purchase upon performance of the conditions stated in the agreement and within an immediate right of possession vested in the conditional vendee or lessee. 
3.  A person renting a snowmobile or having the exclusive use of a snowmobile for more than thirty days. 
C.  "Operate" means to ride in or on and to be in actual physical control of the operation of the snowmobile. 
D.  "Person" means an individual, partnership, corporation, the state or any of its agencies or subdivisions, and any body of persons, whether incorporated or not. 
E.  "Snowmobile" means any motor-driven vehicle designed for travel primarily on snow or ice or a type which utilizes sled-type runners or skis, or an endless belt tread or any combination of these or other similar means of contact with the surface upon which it is operated. It is not a vehicle that must be registered under the Michigan Vehicle Code, PA 300 of 1949, as amended, (MCL 257.1, et seq.) 
F.  "Dealer" means any person engaged in the sale, lease or rental of snowmobiles as a regular business. 
G.  "Highway or street" means the entire width between the boundary lines of every way publicly maintained where any part thereof is open to the use of the public for purposes of vehicular travel. 
H.  "Roadway" means that portion of a highway improved, designated or ordinarily used for vehicular travel. If a highway includes two or more separate roadways, the term roadway refers to any such roadway separately, but not to all such roadways collectively. 
I.  "Right-of-way" means that portion of a highway less the roadway and any shoulder. 
J.  "Shoulder" means that portion of a highway on either side of the roadway that is normally snowplowed for the safety and convenience of vehicular traffic. 
(Ord. No. 2011-14, § 1, 3-8-11) 
10.16.030 - Regulations. 
    No person shall operate and no owner or dealer shall permit the operation of any snowmobile under the following conditions, circumstances or at the following locations: 
A.  Upon a public highway, land used as a street, or on a public or private parking lot not specifically designed for the use of snowmobiles, except under the following conditions and circumstances, pursuant to MCL 324.82119: 
1.  A snowmobile may be operated on the right-of-way of a public highway, except a limited access highway, if it is operated at the extreme right of the open portion of the right-of-way and with the flow of traffic on the highway. However, a snowmobile may be operated on the right-of-way of a public highway against the flow of traffic if the right-of-way is a snowmobile trail designated by the Michigan Department of Natural Resources pursuant to MCL 324.82106(2). Snowmobiles operated on the right-of-way of a public highway, as provided in this subdivision, shall travel single file and shall not be operated abreast except when overtaking and passing another snowmobile. In the absence of a posted snowmobile speed limit, a snowmobile operated on the right-of-way of a public highway, as provided in this subdivision, shall be limited to the speed limit posted on the public highway. 
2.  A snowmobile may be operated on the roadway or shoulder when necessary to cross a bridge or culvert if the snowmobile is brought to a complete stop before entering onto the roadway or shoulder and the driver yields the right-of-way to an approaching vehicle on the highway. 
3.  A snowmobile may be operated across a public highway other than a limited access highway, at right angles to the highway, for the purpose of getting from one area to another when the operation can be done in safety and another vehicle is not crossing the highway at the same time in the same general area. An operator shall bring his/her snowmobile to a complete stop before proceeding across the public highway and shall yield the right-of-way to all oncoming traffic. 
4.  Snowmobiles may be operated on a highway in a county road system that is not normally snowplowed for vehicular traffic and on the plowed right-of-way or shoulder when no right-of-way exists on a snowplowed highway in the county road system, outside the corporate limits of a city or village, that is designated and marked for snowmobile use by the County Road Commission having jurisdiction. 
5.  A duly constituted law enforcement officer of a local unit of government or the state may authorize use of a snowmobile on a public highway or street within his/her jurisdiction when an emergency occurs and conventional motor vehicles cannot be used for transportation due to snow or other extreme highway conditions. 
6.  A snowmobile may be operated on a highway or street for a special event of limited duration conducted according to a prearranged schedule only under permit from the city. The event may be conducted on the frozen surface of public waters only under permit from the Michigan Department of Natural Resources. 
B.  On private property not owned, leased or under the control of the operator unless the operator has the express consent of the owner, lessee, or other person in control of said property, except in case of an emergency when other means of travel are not feasible or possible. 
C.  On public school grounds, parks, playgrounds, recreational areas, golf courses and other public lands (other than state-owned lands where such operation is authorized by statute) without the express consent of the public authority in charge of such lands or premises, except where such operation is absolutely necessary in an emergency when other means of travel are not feasible or possible. 
D.  At a speed greater than is reasonable and proper, having due regard for conditions then existing. 
E.  While under the influence of intoxicating liquor or a controlled substance, or both. 
F.  During the hours from one-half hour after sunset to one-half hour before sunrise without displaying a lighted head light and a lighted tail light. 
G.  In any forest nursery, planting area, or public lands posted or reasonably identifiable as an area of forest reproduction when growing stock may be damaged or as a natural dedicated area. 
H.  On the frozen surface of public waters within one hundred feet of a person, including but not limited to a skater, not in or upon a snowmobile, or within one hundred feet of a fishing shanty or shelter, except at the minimum speed required to maintain forward movement of the snowmobile or on an area which has been cleared of snow for skating purposes unless the area is necessary for access to the frozen public water. 
I.  Unless the snowmobile is equipped with a muffler in good working order and in constant operation from which noise emission at fifty feet at right angles from the vehicle path under full throttle does not exceed eighty-six DBA (decibels on the "A" scale) on a sound meter having characteristics defined by American Standards Association S1, 4-1966 "General Purpose Sound Meter." 
J.  Within one hundred feet of a dwelling between 12:00 midnight and 6:00 a.m., at a speed greater than minimum required to maintain forward movement of the snowmobile. 
K.  In or upon premises which are fenced, otherwise enclosed in a manner to exclude intruders, posted in a conspicuous manner or when notice against trespass is personally communicated to the operator by the owner of the premises or other authorized persons. 
L.  In any area on which public hunting is permitted during the season open to the taking of deer with firearms from 7:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. and from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m., except during an emergency, for lawful enforcement purposes, to go to and from a permanent residence or a hunting camp otherwise inaccessible by a conventional wheeled vehicle or for the conduct of necessary work functions involving land and timber survey, communication and transmission line patrol and timber harvest operations, or on the operator's own property or as an invited guest of an owner or person in control of said property. 
M.  While transporting thereon a bow, unless unstrung or encased, or a firearm, unless unloaded in both barrel and magazine and securely encased. 
N.  On or across a cemetery or burial ground. 
O.  Within one hundred feet of a slide, ski, or skating area except when traveling on a county road right-of-way pursuant to MCL 324.82119 or a snowmobile trail that is designated and funded by the department. A snowmobile may enter such an area for the purpose of servicing the area or for medical emergencies. 
P.  On a railroad or railroad right-of-way, except for railroad, public utility or law enforcement personnel while in the performance of their duties. 
Q.  Unless it has at least one head light, one tail light and adequate brakes capable of stopping the snowmobile on packed snow, carrying an operator weighing one hundred and seventy-five pounds or more in not more than forty feet from an initial steady speed of twenty miles per hour or unless it has operable mechanisms capable of locking the snowmobile's traction belt or belts. 
R.  At any time for use in hunting, pursuing, worrying or killing a wild bird or animal. 
S.  Operators of a snowmobile shall comply with the following conditions, limitations and restrictions with respect to age: 
1.  No person under the age of twelve shall operate a snowmobile except under the direct supervision of an adult and when on land owned or under the control of such adult. 
2.  No person between the ages of twelve and sixteen may operate a snowmobile unless such operator is under the direct supervision of a person who is twenty-one years of age or older; or the operator has in his/her immediate possession a snowmobile safety certificate issued pursuant to MCL 324.82107, or the operator possesses a snowmobile safety certificate issued pursuant to a law of another state or province of Canada; or the operator is operating the same upon land owned or under the control of the operator's parent or legal guardian. 
3.  No person between the ages of twelve and sixteen years shall operate a snowmobile across a highway or street unless the operator has in his/her immediate possession a valid snowmobile safety certificate issued to the operator. 
4.  Any person who operates a snowmobile who is less than sixteen years of age in violation of the within ordinance may, upon reporting of such violation to the Director of the Michigan Department of Natural Resources by any judge of a juvenile court (after trial or acceptance of plea of guilty), have his/her snowmobile safety certificate forthwith suspended by said director. 
5.  No owner of a snowmobile nor parent or legal guardian of a person under the age of sixteen shall permit the use of a snowmobile by such person in violation of this chapter. 
(Ord. No. 2011-14, § 1, 3-8-11) 
10.16.040 - Enforcement. 
    Any police officer, peace officer or ordinance enforcement officer of the city is authorized to issue appearance tickets for violations of the within ordinance pursuant to the Code of Criminal Procedure Act, PA 175 of 1927, as amended, (MCL 764.9c). In any proceedings involving a violation of this act, the registration number displayed on a snowmobile shall constitute prima facie evidence that the owner of the said snowmobile was the person operating the same at the time of the offense. 
(Ord. No. 2011-14, § 1, 3-8-11) 
Chapter 10.20 - MOTOR CARRIER SAFETY[5] 
Sections: 

Footnotes:

    The Michigan Motor Carrier Safety Act, 1963 PA 181, MCL 480.11 to 480.25, and all future amendments and revisions to the Motor Carrier Safety Act when they are effective in this state are incorporated and adopted by reference. 
(Ord. No. 2011-15, § 1, 3-8-11) 
10.20.020 - References in Motor Carrier Safety Act. 
    References in the Motor Carrier Safety Act to township, city, village, county, or another state agency shall mean the City of Wixom. 
(Ord. No. 2011-15, § 1, 3-8-11) 
10.20.030 - Motor Carrier Safety Act penalties. 
    The penalties provided by the Motor Carrier Safety Act are adopted by reference. 
(Ord. No. 2011-15, § 1, 3-8-11) 
Title 12 - STREETS, SIDEWALKS AND PUBLIC PLACES 
  
Chapters: 
Chapter 12.00 - GENERAL 
Sections: 

12.00.005 - Purpose. 
    The purpose of this title is to control and provide a sound but reasonable basis for public improvements and private improvements affecting the public within the city by requiring proper provisions for the use and access of public and private facilities in order to promote the safety, public health, convenience and general welfare of the city. 
(§ 1 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.00.010 - Definitions. 
    The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this title, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning. 
    "Department" means the city department of public services. 
    "Director" means the director of the department of public services or the director's designee. If no such person is employed by the city as director, the city manager or an individual designated by the city manager shall act as the director. 
    "Street" means all the land lying between property lines on either side of all streets, alley and boulevards in the city, and includes lawn extensions and sidewalks and the area reserved therefore where the same are not yet constructed. 
(§ 1 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.00.020 - Authority of department of public services director re additional regulations. 
    In addition to the regulations set forth herein, the director may from time to time make additional regulations pertaining to openings and excavations in public rights-of-way, streets, curbcuts, street obstructions and house moving, all of which shall be subject to city council approval. No person shall fail to comply with any such regulations. 
(§ 1 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.00.030 - Removal of encroachments- 
    Recovery of expenses. 
    Encroachments and obstructions in the street or road right-of-way may be removed by the city and excavations refilled and the expense of such removal or refilling charged to the abutting landowner when made or permitted by or suffered to remain by such landowner otherwise than in accordance with the terms and conditions of this title. Unpaid charges incurred pursuant to this section shall be a lien against the subject property. Enforcement of this lien shall be made pursuant to city ordinances or under any applicable statute. 
(§ 1 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.00.040 - Temporary street closings. 
    The director shall have the authority to temporarily close any street, or portion thereof, when the director deems such street to be unsafe or temporarily unsuitable for use for any reason. The director shall cause suitable barriers and signs to be erected on such street indicating that the same is closed to public travel. No person shall drive any vehicle upon or over such street except as may be necessary incidental to any street repair or construction work being done in the area closed to public travel. No person shall move or interfere with any sign or barrier pursuant to this title without authority from the director. The director shall notify the city manager of all temporary street closures prior to same. 
(§ 1 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.00.050 - Vacating streets. 
A.  Whenever the city council shall deem it advisable to vacate, discontinue or abolish any right-of-way, road, street or alley, or any part thereof, it shall so declare by resolution. In the same resolution the council shall appoint a time when it will meet and hear objections thereto. 
B.  Notice of such meeting shall be published in a newspaper of general circulation in the city, not less than thirty days before the time appointed for such meeting. Notice shall be given by first class mail to owners of all property abutting such right-of-way, road, street or alley, or any part thereof, as shown upon the assessment rolls of the city. 
C.  If after such hearing the council shall determine to vacate, discontinue or abolish such right-of-way, road, street or alley, or any part thereof, it shall do so by resolution. The council may reserve an easement for public or private utility purposes within the right-of-way of any road, street or alley vacated, discontinued or abolished, and may by resolution extinguish any such easement whenever such easement ceases to be used for such utility purposes. Passage of a resolution to vacate shall require the affirmative vote of at least four members of council. 
D.  The application and permit forms shall be obtained upon application to the department upon such forms as the director shall prescribe. An application fee shall be paid by petitioner in an amount as established by resolution by the city council. 
(§ 1 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.00.060 - Enforcement. 
    Any use or activity in violation of the terms of this chapter is declared to be a nuisance per se, and may be abated by order of any court of competent jurisdiction. The City Council, in addition to other remedies may institute any appropriate action or proceeding to prevent, abate or restrain the violation. All costs, fees and expenses in connection with such action shall be assessed as damages against the violation. 
(§ 1 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.00.070 - Violation-Penalty. 
    Any person, firm, corporation or other legal entity violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor, and upon conviction therefore shall be fined not more than five hundred dollars for each such conviction, or shall be punished by imprisonment for a period not to exceed ninety days for each offense, or by both such fine and imprisonment in the discretion of the court, together with the costs of such prosecution. Each day upon which such violation shall occur shall constitute a separate offense. 
(§ 1 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
Chapter 12.02 - STREETS 
Sections: 

12.02.010 - Definitions. 
    The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this chapter, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning. 
    "Department" means the city department of public service. 
    "Director" means the director of the department of public services or the director's designee. If no such person is employed by the city as director, the city manager or an individual designated by the city manager shall act as the director. 
    "Street" means all of the land lying between property lines on either side of all streets, alleys and boulevards in the city, and includes lawn extensions and sidewalks and the area reserved therefor where the same are not yet constructed. 
(§ 2 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.02.020 - Damage, obstructions prohibited-Exceptions. 
    No person shall make an excavation in or cause any damage to any street in the city, except under the conditions and in the manner permitted in the chapter. No person shall place any article, thing or obstruction in any street, except under the conditions and in the manner permitted in this chapter, but this provision shall not be deemed to prohibit the following: 
A.  Such temporary obstructions as may be incidental to the expeditious movement of articles and things to and from abutting premises; 
B.  The lawful parking of vehicles within the part of the street reserved for vehicular traffic; 
C.  The planting of trees and shrubs, or placing any other installation therein when and as specifically authorized by any provision of this code. 
(§ 2 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.02.030 - Permits, bonds and deposits. 
A.  Where permits are authorized in this chapter, they shall be obtained upon application to the department upon such forms as the director shall prescribe, and there shall be a charge provided by resolution of the council. Such permit shall be revocable by the director for failure to comply with this chapter, rules and regulations adopted pursuant hereto, and the lawful orders of the director or the director's duly authorized representative, and shall be valid only for the period of time endorsed thereon. Application for a permit under the provisions of this chapter shall be deemed an agreement by the applicant to promptly complete the work permitted, observe all pertinent laws and regulations of the city in connection therewith, repair all damage done to the street surface and installations on, over or within such street, including trees, and protect and save harmless the city from all damages or actions at law that may arise or may be brought on account of injury to persons or property resulting from the work done under the permit or in connection therewith. 
B.  Liability insurance policies are required to be filed in making application for a permit and shall be in not less than the amounts as provided by resolution of the council. A duplicate executed copy or photostatic copy of the original of such insurance policy shall be filed with the department. 
C.  Where cash deposits are required with the application for any permit under this chapter, such deposit shall be in an amount as established by resolution of the council, and such deposit shall be used to defray all expenses to the city arising out of the granting of the permit and work done under the permit or in connection therewith. Six months after the completion of the work done under the permit, any balance of such cash deposit unexpended shall be refunded. In any case where the deposit does not cover all costs and expenses of the city, the deficit shall be paid by the applicant. 
(§ 2 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.02.040 - Inspection. 
    Either full- or part-time inspection will be required by the director pursuant to this chapter. Fees for these inspections shall be paid by the permittee in such amounts as established by resolution of the council. 
(§ 2 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.02.050 - Street options generally-Permit. 
    No person shall make any excavation or opening in or under any street without first obtaining a written permit from the department. No permit shall be granted until the applicant shall post a cash deposit and file a liability insurance policy as required by this chapter. 
(§ 2 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.02.060 - Emergency openings. 
    The director may, if the public safety requires immediate action, grant permission to make a necessary street opening in an emergency, provided that a permit shall be obtained on the following business day and the provisions of this chapter shall be complied with. The director shall notify the city manager of all street openings prior to same. 
(§ 2 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.02.070 - Backfilling. 
    All trenches in a public right-of-way, public street or other public place, except by special permission, shall be backfilled in accordance with regulation adopted pursuant to the city engineering design standards. Any settlement shall be corrected within eight hours after notification to do so. 
(§ 2 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.02.080 - Placement of utility poles. 
    Utility poles may be placed in such streets as the director shall prescribe and shall be located thereon in accordance with the directions of the director. Such poles shall be removed or relocated as the director shall from time to time direct. 
(§ 2 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.02.090 - Maintenance of installations in street. 
    Every owner of, and every person in control of, any property hereafter maintaining a sidewalk vault, coal hole, manhole or any other excavation, or post, pole, sign, awning, wire, conduit or other structure in, under, over or upon any right-of-way, street or other public place which is adjacent to or part of the property shall do so only on condition that such maintenance shall be considered as an agreement on such person's part with the city to keep the same and the covers thereof, and any gas and electric boxes and tubes thereon, in good repair and condition at all times during such person's ownership or control thereof, and to indemnify and save harmless the City against all damages or actions at law that may arise or be brought by reason of such excavation or structure being under, over, in or upon the right-of-way, street or other public place, or being unfastened, out of repair or defective during such ownership or control. 
(§ 2 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.02.100 - Enforcement. 
    Any use or activity in violation of the terms of this chapter is declared to be a nuisance per se, and may be abated by order of any court of competent jurisdiction. The city council, in addition to other remedies may institute any appropriate action or proceeding to prevent, abate or restrain the violation. All costs, fees and expenses in connection with such action shall be assessed as damages against the violation. 
(§ 2 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.02.110 - Violation-Penalty. 
    Any person, firm, corporation or other legal entity violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor, and upon conviction therefore shall be fined not more than five hundred dollars for each such conviction, or shall be punished by imprisonment for a period not to exceed ninety days for each offense, or by both such fine and imprisonment in the discretion of the court, together with the costs of such prosecution. Each day upon which such violation shall occur shall constitute a separate offense. 
(§ 2 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
Chapter 12.03 - CURBCUTS 
Sections: 

12.03.010 - Permit required. 
    No opening in or through any curb or any street shall be made without first obtaining a written permit from the department of public services. Curbcuts and sidewalk driveway crossings to provide access to private property shall comply with the provisions of this chapter and the city engineering design standards. 
(§ 3 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.03.020 - Width of driveways. 
    The minimum width of a driveway approach at the sidewalk line shall be per the City engineering design standards. 
(§ 3 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.03.030 - Distance from crosswalks. 
    The minimum distance between any curbcut and a public crosswalk shall be per the city engineering design standards. 
(§ 3 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.03.040 - Distance between curbcuts. 
    The minimum distance between curbcuts, except those serving residential property, shall be determined on an individual basis by the department. 
(§ 3 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.03.050 - Size of sidewalk driveway crossings. 
    The maximum number of lineal feet of sidewalk driveway crossing permitted for any lot, parcel of land, business or enterprise shall be per the city engineering design standards. 
(§ 3 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.03.060 - Adjustments to public improvements and installations. 
    The adjustments made necessary by curbcuts to utility poles, light standards, fire hydrants, catch basins, street or railway signs, signals or other public improvements or installations shall be accomplished without cost to the city. 
(§ 3 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.03.070 - Enforcement. 
    Any use or activity in violation of the terms of this chapter is declared to be a nuisance per se, and may be abated by order of any court of competent jurisdiction. The city council, in addition to other remedies may institute any appropriate action or proceeding to prevent, abate or restrain the violation. All costs, fees and expenses in connection with such action shall be assessed as damages against the violation. 
(§ 3 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.03.080 - Violation-Penalty. 
    Any person, firm, corporation or other legal entity violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor, and upon conviction therefore shall be fined not more than five hundred dollars for each such conviction, or shall be punished by imprisonment for a period not to exceed ninety days for each offense, or by both such fine and imprisonment in the discretion of the court, together with the costs of such prosecution. Each day upon which such violation shall occur shall constitute a separate offense. 
(§ 3 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
Chapter 12.04 - SIDEWALKS AND BIKE PATHS 
Sections: 

12.04.010 - Definitions. 
    The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this chapter, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning. 
    "Department" means the city department of public services. 
    "Director" means the director of the department of public services or the director's designee. If no such person is employed by the city as director, the city manager or an individual designated by the city manager shall act as the director. 
    "Major roads" means roadways defined as city major streets, county primary roads, and state trunk lines in accordance with Act 51 of the Public Acts of 1951, as amended. 
    "Owner" means any of the following: 
1.  The person to whom the real property is assessed on the city tax roll; 
2.  The person in the process of developing property for use and constructing sidewalks as a part of common improvements to the development and who has not released the responsibility of maintenance of those improvements to an established homeowner or association; 
3.  The association of homeowners or owners having the responsibility for the maintenance and repair of common areas of a residential development. 
    "Sidewalk" means the portion of the street right-of-way designed and improved for pedestrian and nonmotorized travel. 
(§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.04.020 - Adherence to specifications- Permit required. 
    No person shall construct, rebuild or repair any sidewalk except in accordance with the line, grade, slope and specifications established by the director nor without first obtaining a written permit from the department, except that sidewalk repairs on less than fifty square feet of sidewalk may be made without a permit. The written permit shall be prominently displayed on the construction site. The fee for such permit shall be set by resolution of the council. 
(§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.04.030 - Line and grade stakes. 
    The permittee shall provide to the department approved line and grade stakes as may be necessary for proper control of work under this chapter. This shall not relieve the owner of the responsibility for making careful and accurate measurements in constructing the work to the line and grade approved by the director. 
(§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.04.040 - Construction and maintenance specifications. 
    Sidewalks shall be constructed and maintained in accordance with the standards and specifications as established by the director and approved by the city council. 
(§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.04.050 - Permit revocation. 
    Sidewalks shall be constructed and maintained in accordance with the standards and specifications as established by the director and approved by the city council. 
(§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.04.060 - Obstructions. 
    The owner and/or occupant of every lot or premises adjoining any street, or the owner of such lot or premises, if same are not occupied, shall clear and keep clear all sidewalks adjoining such lot or premises from any obstructions including, but not limited to, structures, vehicles, materials, debris, vegetation, snow, ice or other similar items. 
(§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.04.070 - Maintenance. 
    No person shall permit any sidewalk which adjoins property owned by such person to fall into a state of disrepair or to be unsafe. 
(§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.04.080 - Sidewalks needing repair-Notice to property owner-Repair by city. 
A.  Whenever the city determines that a sidewalk is unsafe for use, notice may be given to the owner of the lot or premises adjacent to and abutting upon such sidewalk of the city's determination. Such notice shall be given in accordance with subsection C of this section. Thereafter, is shall be the duty of the owner to place the sidewalk in a safe condition. Such notice shall specify a reasonable time, not less than ten days, within which such work shall be completed. 
B.  If the owner of such lot or premises shall refuse or neglect to repair the sidewalk within the time limit therefor, or in a manner otherwise than in accordance with this chapter, the city shall have the sidewalk repaired. If the city determines that the condition of the sidewalk is such that immediate repair is necessary to protect the public, the city may dispense with the notice and institute the repairs immediately. In any event, the cost of repairs under this chapter shall be charged against the premises which adjoins the sidewalk and shall be paid by the owner of the premises. Unpaid charges incurred pursuant to this section shall be a lien against the subject property. Enforcement of this lien shall be made pursuant to city ordinances or under any applicable statute. 
C.  Notice regarding sidewalk repairs shall be served in the following manner: 
1.  By delivering the notice to the owner personally or by leaving the same at the owner's residence, office or place of business; 
2.  By mailing the notice by certified or registered mail to such owner at his or her last known address; or 
3.  If the owner is unknown, by posting the notice in some conspicuous place on the premises at least fifteen days before the required work shall be completed. No person shall interfere with, obstruct, mutilate, conceal or tear down any official notice or placard posted by any city official, unless permission is given by such officer to remove the notice. (§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.04.090 - Sidewalks located on major roads. 
    The chapter shall not apply to sidewalks located along major roads. 
(§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.04.091 - Sidewalks required. 
A.  Concrete paved sidewalks not less than five feet wide shall be required in all subdivisions, site condominium subdivisions, cluster housing developments, and planned residential developments within the city. 
B.  Concrete paved sidewalks shall be required along all access drives in multiple family developments. 
C.  Sidewalks shall be constructed in accordance with the engineering design standards of the city. (§ 2 of Ord. dated 10-28-97) 
12.04.092 - Bike paths required. 
A.  Concrete paved bike paths shall be required in all subdivisions, site condominium subdivisions, cluster housing developments, planned residential developments, commercial, industrial, and residential sites within the city in accordance with the Wixom master bike path plan. 
B.  Bike paths shall be constructed in accordance with the engineering design standards of the city and shall not be less than six feet wide except as follows: 
1.  Concrete paved bike paths not less than eight feet wide shall be required where mandated by a superseding public agency or governmental entity. 
2.  Concrete paved bike paths with a minimum width of five feet may be allowed where an appeal is brought to the department of public services citing the specific reasons and supporting documentation therefore. 
C.  Where the master bike path plan anticipates a proposed bike path, the owner and/or the developer of the property shall dedicate an easement to the city for bike path purposes as required by the engineering design standards of the city and shall prepare the area for the future bike path in a manner approved by the director of public services. For purposes of this chapter, "prepare" means removing obstructions, grading and clearing the location, and placing topsoil, seed and mulch or otherwise providing for soil stabilization in the proposed area. 
    The owner and/or developer who is preparing the area shall landscape the prepared area, but in no instance shall obstructions of a permanent nature be placed upon the prepared location. 
(§ 3 of Ord. dated 10-28-97) 
12.04.100 - Appeals. 
A.  Any owner who believes the actions of the city pursuant to this chapter are improper may appeal the decision of the city to the city council, provided such appeal is filed with the city clerk's office within ten days of receipt or posting of a notice under this chapter. The appeal shall be in writing and shall state in clear and concise language the reasons for the appeal. 
B.  The timely filing of an appeal shall stay all proceedings related thereto pending the outcome of the appeal. 
C.  The city clerk shall immediately deliver a copy of the appeal to the city manager and shall place the appeal hearing on the agenda of the next available city council meeting. 
D.  At the conclusion of the appeal hearing, the city council may affirm, modify or rescind the decision of the city. The decision of the city council shall be final. 
(§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.04.110 - Damaging public ways. 
    No person shall use any mechanically driven vehicle for removal of snow from sidewalks, other pedestrian easements, streets or alleys in the city which will, by virtue of its use for such purpose, damage or tend to damage any sidewalk, improvement easement, street or alley in the city. The use of mechanically driven vehicles for such purpose shall be lawful only where such mechanically driven vehicles do not cause such prohibited damage. 
(§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.04.120 - Enforcement. 
    Any use or activity in violation of the terms of this chapter is declared to be a nuisance per se, and may be abated by order of any court of competent jurisdiction. The city council, in addition to other remedies may institute any appropriate action or proceeding to prevent, abate or restrain the violation. All costs, fees and expenses in connection with such action shall be assessed as damages against the violation. 
(§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.04.130 - Violation-Penalty. 
    Any person, firm, corporation or other legal entity violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor, and upon conviction therefore shall be fined not more than five hundred dollars for each such conviction, or shall be punished by imprisonment for a period not to exceed ninety days for each offense, or by both such fine and imprisonment for a period not to exceed ninety days for each offense, or by both such fine and imprisonment in the discretion of the court, together with the costs of such prosecution. Each day upon which such violation shall occur shall constitute a separate offense. 
(§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
Chapter 12.05 - SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR EXCAVATIONS 
Sections: 

12.05.010 - Barricades and warning lights. 
    All openings, excavations and obstructions shall be properly and substantially barricaded and railed off, and at night shall be provided with prescribed warning lights as required per the Michigan Uniform Traffic Control Manual. Additional barricades shall be provided as required by the director of the department of public services. 
(§ 4 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.05.020 - Sheeting and bracing. 
    All openings and excavations shall, where necessary, be properly and substantially sheeted and braced as a safeguard to the public and to prevent cave-ins or washouts which would tend to injure the thoroughfare or subsurface structure of the street. 
(§ 5 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
Chapter 12.06 - DRAINAGE COURSES 
Sections: 
Article II. - Building Operations 
Article III. - Obstructions 
Article IV. - Roadside Drainage Ditches 
Article V. - Enforcement and Violation 
Article II. - Building Operations 

12.06.110 - Definitions. 
    The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this article, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
    "Building contractor" means any person holding a general contract for the construction of a building or structure. If no such person is employed by an owner, then in such cases the owner of the property affected shall be the building contractor. 
    "Department" means the city department of public services. 
    "Director" means the director of the department of public services or the director's designee. If no such person is employed by the city as director, the city manager, or an individual designated by the city manager shall act as the director. 
    "Street" means all of the land lying between property lines on either side of all streets, alleys and boulevards in the city, and indicates lawn extensions and sidewalks and the area reserved therefore where the same are not yet constructed. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.120 - Applicability. 
    The operation of this chapter shall be restricted to the time extending from the date of issuance of a building permit to the date of issuance of an occupancy permit by the city. This chapter shall not be interpreted to refer to the depositing of any soil or debris in roadside ditches cause by the elements or by acts of nature. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.130 - Depositing materials in drainage way. 
    Dirt, sand, gravel, clay or any other type of soil shall not be moved into or deposited in any roadside ditch, drain or gutter in the city after the time such ditch, drain or gutter is cut. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.140 - Depositing materials in right-of-way. 
    No building materials of any sort may be unloaded or deposited or stored on any lands previously dedicated to the public use for right-of-way for a street. Building materials shall only be unloaded onto, deposited or stored on the private land adjoining such publicly dedicated right-of-way for street purposes to be served by such building materials. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.150 - Culvert installation. 
    After the cutting of a roadside drainage ditch, and before any building operations are continued or carried on upon private lands adjoining such roadside ditch, the building contractor shall provide and install a ditch culvert of material as approved by the director and of a diameter approved by the highway authority having jurisdiction, and cover the same across the roadside drainage ditch with sufficient material as approved by the director to prevent damage to the culvert by vehicular traffic passing over the same. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.160 - Ditch installation. 
    The building contractor shall provide a roadside ditch across the entire frontage of the site, except where culverts are necessary for access or utility or tree interference. The requirements for this ditch shall be in accordance with the standards and specification of the highway authority having jurisdiction over such road. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.170 - Contractor responsible for violations. 
    The building contractor shall be held prima facie responsible for the existence of any prohibited materials in roadside ditches, after the same are cut, within the area of the roadside ditch in front of the lot upon which the building contractor is conducting his or her operation. Such area shall be determined by the continuation of the side lot lines in their same direction until they will cross the roadside ditch, and the areas between such extended lines will be the roadside ditch area of such adjoining lot. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.180 - Notice to correct violation-Stop- work order. 
    Upon the discovery by the director of the existence of any prohibited materials in such roadside ditches, the director shall thereupon notify the building contractor of such violation by posting a notice on or in the house or structure being built upon the adjoining land, or by nailing such notice to a stake placed in the ground in a conspicuous position on the premises. At the same time such notice is posted, the director shall, in a like manner, post a stop-work order on the building, which will prohibit any further building operations being carried on. If within twenty-four hours after the posting of the first notice as provided above the building contractor shall have removed all prohibited materials from roadside ditches, and deposited the same on private lands adjoining, and shall have replaced the roadside ditch to the same condition as before, then the director shall authorize the withdrawal of the notice of violation, and shall authorize the withdrawal of the stop-work order as provided above. If such prohibited material is not removed from the roadside ditch and deposited on adjoining private lands, and the roadside ditch is not replaced to its previous condition with twenty-four hours after the posting of such notice, the building contractor shall be guilty of a violation of this chapter. In such event, the stop-work order shall continue in effect and all building operations shall be prohibited until the violation is cured. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.190 - Security deposit. 
    Upon application for a building permit, the applicant shall deposit with the application a sum established by resolution of the council to guarantee that after completion of the building, the applicant shall remove or cause to be removed all debris, rubbish and trash from the building site and to establish ditches and culverts to properly drain the building area, and to reopen and reestablish any drainage that may have been interrupted by the building operation. All drains and culverts shall be established in accordance with the requirements and specifications of the highway authority having jurisdiction. The deposit shall be returned to the applicant upon demand after the final inspection and approval by the director. If, after approval by the director, demand for the return of the deposit is not made by the applicant within one year after the issuance of a certificate of occupancy, the sum shall be deposited in the general fund of the city. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
Article III. - Obstructions 

12.06.210 - Definitions. 
    The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this article, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
    "Department" means the city department of public services. 
    "Director" means the director of the department of public services or the director's designee. If no such person is employed by the city as director, the city manager, or an individual designated by the city manager shall act as the director. 
    "Drain" means every ditch, stream, watercourse, swale, sewer, pipe or other conduit of any kind whether natural or artificial, whether or not established by any public authority, over or through which surface water normally passes within the city. 
    "Street" means all the land lying between property lines on either side of the streets, alleys and boulevards in the city, and includes lawn extensions and sidewalks and the area reserved therefore where the same are not yet constructed. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.220 - Prohibited. 
    No person shall obstruct or cause to be obstructed any drain by any means whatsoever, so as to prevent or retard the free flow of surface water thereon or therein. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.230 - Permitted obstruction. 
    No owner, lessee or other person in possession of any property over which a drain exists shall suffer or permit such drain to be obstructed by any means whatsoever so as to prevent or retard the free flow of surface waters thereon or therein, or suffer or permit such an existing obstruction to continue. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.240 - Increasing and diverting flow. 
    No person, other than a governmental agency authorized by law to manage drains or stormwater easements, shall divert, enclose, reconstruct or relocate any drain so as to cause such drain to discharge upon any property within the city, with increased force, in an increased amount or at a different location without the express written consent of all parties in interest in the property upon which the drain is to discharge. Such consent shall be in recordable form and shall be recorded in the office of the county register of deeds. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.250 - Report of violation- Determination re-drainage area. 
    Any owner of property over which a drain is alleged to exist, or of property within the drainage area served by an alleged drain, who claims that such alleged drain has been or is being obstructed or diverted in the location thereof and the properties drained thereby. Upon receipt of such a petition, the city council may direct the department to report to the council with respect to the location of the alleged drain, its history, the area drained thereby and any other pertinent facts concerning the drain. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.260 - Hearing-Council determination. 
    Upon receipt of a petition submitted pursuant to this chapter and the report of the director, the council shall hold a hearing thereon and shall give notice thereof by first class mail to the property owners affected. Following such hearing the council may adopt a resolution defining the location of the drain and the property drained thereby. Such resolution shall be prima facie evidence thereof in any prosecution for violation of this chapter; provided, however, that the procedures described in this chapter shall not be deemed to be conditions precedent of a prosecution for violation of this chapter. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
Article IV. - Roadside Drainage Ditches 

12.06.310 - Definitions. 
    The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this article, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning: 
    "Department" means the city department of public services. 
    "Director" means the director of the department of public services or the director's designee. If no such person is employed by the city as the director, the city manager or an individual designated by the city manager shall act as the director. 
    "Driveway" means every parking lot, private road, common driveway or similar feature, whether or not open for open use. 
    "Gutter" means the gutter area of a paved and curbed street. 
    "Roadside ditch" means every ditch, culvert, swale or other watercourse permitting the normal flow of water which drains off public streets and highways. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.320 - Permit to construct driveway and install culvert across-Required. 
    No person shall cause the construction or connection of any driveway which crosses a roadside ditch nor install a culvert as may be required in this chapter, nor change the flow of water in any such roadside ditch, without first obtaining a permit from the department. All connection or construction shall require the installation of a proper culvert as required by the department. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.330 - Same-Application-Fee. 
    Application for a permit to connect or construct a driveway across or through a roadside ditch, or to install a culvert as directed by authority of this article shall be made in writing to the department on a form supplied by the director. Such application shall be accompanied by a permit fee in an amount set by resolution of the council. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.340 - Performance bond. 
    No permit shall be issued under this article until a cash performance bond has been filed with the department in an amount sufficient to insure performance of the work in conformity with the permit and rules, regulations and specifications of the department. The amount of the cash bond shall be established by resolution of the council. Such bond shall be forfeited where the permitted construction, connection or installation is not in conformance with the rules, regulations and specifications of the department, or when the permitted construction, connection or installation is not completed for final inspection and approval on or before the expiration date of the permit. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.350 - Inspection. 
A.  Upon notification of completion of work permitted under this chapter to the department, the director shall make an on-site inspection of the construction to determine whether the specification requirements have been met. 
B.  If the construction is satisfactory, the permit holder will be refunded the bond upon application therefor to the department. 
C.  If the construction is not satisfactory, the permit holder shall be notified of all defects. Notification of deficiency may be given to the applicant. 
D.  The permit holder may correct such defects and request a second inspection upon payment of an additional inspection fee to the department, prior to the expiration date of the permit. The amount of the fee shall be established by resolution of the council. (§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.360 - Existing driveways blocking. 
    When an owner of an existing driveway fails to maintain such driveway in accordance with the specifications and rules of the department of this code by allowing the driveway, due to its particular construction or disrepair, partially or completely block a roadside ditch, written notice of such defective condition shall be served upon the owner. Such notice shall require that the condition be corrected by a date certain, which date shall be not less than fifteen days from the date of service of such notice. Within fifteen days following service of such notice, the owner shall advise the city in writing of his or her intention to install the necessary culvert or perform the necessary repairs, and shall proceed with the required work in accordance with this article. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.370 - Plans, specifications and work subject to approval. 
    The size, quality, kind, grade and number of culverts to be installed and the kind, grade, quality and amount of all the material to be installed, placed, used or deposited under the provisions of this article shall be subject to the prior approval of the department, and all work and labor performed under the provisions hereof shall be performed under the control and supervision and subject to the approval of the department. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.380 - Construction by city-Recovery of costs. 
    Whenever the owner of real property notified pursuant to this chapter fails, neglects or refuses to comply with the chapter or any notices given by authority of this chapter within the time provided, the department may cause the material, work and labor set forth in such notice to be furnished by or on behalf of the city, and proceed to perform such work. Upon completion thereof, the cost of the work shall be charged against the premises. Unpaid charges incurred pursuant to this section shall be a lien against the subject property. Enforcement of this lien shall be made pursuant to city ordinances or under any applicable statute. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
Article V. - Enforcement and Violation 

12.06.400 - Enforcement. 
    Any use or activity in violation of the terms of this chapter is declared to be a nuisance per se, and may be abated by order of any court of competent jurisdiction. The city council, in addition to other remedies may institute any appropriate action or proceeding to prevent, abate or restrain the violation. All costs, fees and expenses in connection with such action shall be assessed as damages against the violation. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
12.06.410 - Violation-Penalty. 
    Any person, firm, corporation or other legal entity violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor, and upon conviction therefore shall be fined not more than five hundred dollars for each such conviction, or shall be punished by imprisonment for a period not to exceed ninety days for each offense, or by both such fine and imprisonment in the discretion of the court, together with the costs of such prosecution. Each day upon which such violation shall occur shall constitute a separate offense. 
(§ 6 (part) of Ord. dated 10-24-95) 
Chapter 12.08 - SNOW REMOVAL 
Sections: 

12.08.010 - Short title. 
    The short title of the ordinance codified in this chapter shall be the Snow Removal Ordinance and it may be referred to and cited by reference thereto. 
(Ord. 110 § 1, 1979) 
12.08.020 - Definitions. 
    The following terms as used in this chapter shall have the meanings defined in this section: 
    "Person" shall not include the state or a political subdivision of the state or an employee of the state or a political subdivision of the state operating within the scope of his duties. 
    "Safety vision" means an unobstructed line of sight enabling a driver to travel upon, enter or exit a roadway in a safe manner. 
    "Street or highway" means the entire width between boundary lines of every way publicly maintained when any part thereof is open to the use of the public for purposes of vehicular travel. 
    "Roadway" means that portion of a highway improved, designed or ordinarily used for vehicular travel. In the event a highway includes two or more separate roadways, the term "roadway" as used in this chapter refers to any such roadway separately, but not to all such roadways collectively. 
(Ord. 110 § 2, 1979) 
12.08.030 - Removal regulated. 
    It is unlawful at any time for any person or persons within the city to: 
A.  Remove or cause to be removed, snow, ice or slush onto or across streets, highways or roadways or the shoulder of streets, highways or roadways in a manner which obstructs the safety vision of the driver of a motor vehicle other than off-road vehicles; 
B.  Deposit or cause to be deposited, snow, ice or slush onto or across streets, highways or roadways or the shoulders of streets, highways or roadways in a manner which obstructs the safety vision of the driver or a motor vehicle; 
C.  Deposit or cause to be deposited, snow, ice or slush on any street, highway or roadway. 
(Ord. 110 § 3, 1979) 
12.08.040 - Violation-Penalty. 
    Any person or persons violating any provisions of this chapter shall, upon conviction thereof, be subject to a fine of not more than five hundred dollars or be imprisoned for a period of not more than ninety days, or to both fine and imprisonment in the discretion of the court. 
(Ord. 110 § 4, 1979) 
Chapter 12.12 - CITY PARK AND RECREATION AREA USE REGULATIONS 
Sections: 

12.12.010 - Purpose. 
    The purpose of the ordinance codified in this chapter is to provide rules and regulations for the use of and conduct in the parks and recreation areas of the city. 
(Ord. 127 § 1, 1983) 
12.12.020 - Applicability. 
    This chapter shall apply in all parks and recreation areas under the jurisdiction of the city, unless expressly exempted. For the issuance of permits, temporary designations, authorizations, granting of approval and other actions the approving governing agency shall be the Parks and Recreation Commission or its designee. 
(Ord. 127 § 2, 1983) 
12.12.030 - Construction. 
    In the interpretation of this and all succeeding park and recreation area ordinances, the provisions shall be construed as follows: 
A.  Any requirement or prohibitions of any act, shall respectively extend to and include the causing and procuring, directly or indirectly, of such act. 
B.  No provision of this chapter shall make unlawful any act necessarily performed by any officer or employee of the commission or city in line of duty or work as such, or by any person, his agent or employees, in the proper and necessary execution of the terms of any agreement with the commission or city. 
C.  Any act otherwise prohibited by law or local ordinance shall be lawful, if performed, under, by virtue of, and strictly within the provisions of a permit so to do, and to the extent authorized thereby. 
(Ord. 127 § 3, 1983) 
12.12.040 - Definitions. 
    For the purposes of this chapter, the following terms shall have the following meanings: 
    "Animals" includes cats, dogs, horses, any fowl or birds and any living creatures within the jurisdiction of the park or recreation area. 
    "Approving government agency" means the Parks and Recreation Commission or its designee. 
    "Crossing" means any crossing whether marked by a pavement or otherwise; the extension to any sidewalk space across any intersecting drive, street, highway. 
    "Curb" means any boundary of any street, road, avenue, boulevard, or drive, whether or not marked by a curb. 
    "Director" means the chairman of the Parks and Recreation Commission unless an employee position of recreation director is established by the city council. In the absence of said employee or a vacancy in the position, the chairman shall serve as director. 
    "Park attendant" means any person employed by the commission as a parks attendant to perform duties or tasks within the park and recreation areas. 
    "Path" means any footpath, walk, or any path maintained for pedestrians. 
    "Pedestrian" means a person afoot. 
    "Permit" means any written license issued by or under the authority of the approving governing agency permitting a special event or activity on park facilities. 
    "Person" means any natural person, corporation, company, association, joint stock association, firm or copartnership. 
    "Soliciting" means persons selling goods or services by sample or taking orders for future delivery with or without accepting advance payment for the goods. Persons seeking any form of contributions. 
    "Stopping or standing" when prohibited means any cessation of movement of a vehicle occupied or not, except when necessary to avoid conflict with pedestrians or other traffic including horses and bicycles. 
    "Traffic" means pedestrians, ridden or herded animals and vehicles, either singly or together. 
    "Vehicle" means any conveyance (except baby carriages) including motor vehicles, trailers of all types, campers, tricycles, bicycles, motorized or not, snowmobiles, sleds, sleighs, pushcarts, or vehicles propelled by other than muscular power. Also any horse or horse-drawn conveyance. 
    "Vending" means selling or trading any item or service. 
(Ord. 127 § 4, 1983) 
12.12.050 - Structures, flora and fauna. 
    It is unlawful for any person in a public park or recreation area to: 
A.  Mark, deface, disfigure, injure, tamper with or displace or remove any buildings, bridges, tables, benches, fireplaces, railings, pavings or paving materials, water lines or other public utilities or parts or appurtenances thereof, signs, notices or placards, whether temporary or permanent, monuments, stakes, posts, or other boundary markers, or other structures or equipment, facilities or park property or appurtenances whatsoever, either real or personal; 
B.  Fail to cooperate in maintaining restrooms and washrooms in a neat and sanitary condition. No person over the age of six years shall use the restrooms and washrooms designated for the opposite sex; 
C.  Dig or remove any soil, rock, sand, stones, trees, shrubs or plants or other wood or materials, or make any excavation by tool, equipment, blasting or other means or agency. 
D.  Construct or erect any building or structure of whatever kind, whether permanent or temporary, or run or string any public service utility into, upon, or across such lands, except on special written permit issued hereunder; 
E.  Damage, cut, carve, mark, transplant or remove any plant, or injure the bark, or pick flowers or seed of any tree or plant, dig in or otherwise disturb grass areas, or in any other way injure the natural beauty or usefulness of any area; 
F.  Climb any tree or walk, climb, stand or sit upon monuments, vases, planters, fountains, railings, fences or upon any other property not designated or customarily used for such purposes; 
G.  Attach any rope or cable or other contrivance to any tree, fence, railing, bridge, bench, or other structure; 
H.  Throw, discharge, or otherwise place or cause to be placed in the waters of any fountains, pond, lake, stream or other body of water in or adjacent to any park or any tributary, stream, storm sewer, or drain flowing into such water, any substance, matter or thing, liquid or solid, which will or may result in the pollution of said waters; 
I.  Bring into any park refuse or litter originating outside any park for the purpose of depositing such in park receptacles. Take into, carry through, or put into any park, any rubbish, refuse, garbage or other material. Such refuse and rubbish shall be deposited in receptacles so provided. Where receptacles are not provided, all such rubbish or waste shall be carried away from the park by the person responsible for its presence, and properly disposed of elsewhere; 
J.  Bring any glass beverage container into any park or recreation area; 
K.  Cause or permit to run loose any animal; 
L.  Tie or hitch an animal to any tree or plant; 
M.  Hunt, molest, harm, frighten, kill, trap, pursue, chase, tease, shoot or throw missiles at any animal, wildlife, reptile or bird; nor shall he remove or have in his possession the young of any wild animal, or the eggs or nest, or young of any reptile or bird. Exception to the foregoing is made in that snakes known to be deadly poisonous may be killed on sight; 
N.  Walk a dog or other domestic animal without a leash, said leash to be no longer than six feet. Further, the owner or person having custody of said domestic animal shall be responsible for removal of any animal solid waste. Further, said responsible person shall not allow the animal to disturb or annoy park visitors. 
(Ord. 127 § 5, 1983) 
12.12.060 - Vehicles. 
    It is unlawful for any person in a public park or recreation area to: 
A.  Drive any vehicle on any area except the paved park roads or parking areas, or such areas as may on occasion be specifically designated as temporary parking areas; 
B.  Park a vehicle anywhere except on a designated parking area; 
C.  Leave a vehicle standing or parked in established parking areas or elsewhere in the park and recreation areas during the hours when the park and recreation area is closed. During a snow storm and for the three days thereafter established parking areas in parks and recreation areas may be utilized for parking, but not by trailers of any kind; 
D.  Leave a bicycle in a place others than a bicycle rack when such is provided and there is space available; 
E.  Ride a bicycle without reasonable regard to the safety of others; 
F.  Leave a bicycle lying on the ground or paving or set against trees, or in any place or position where other persons may trip over or be injured by them; 
G.  Operate any vehicle in excess of posted signs or traffic control devices;
